channel.title: How much memory?
channel.description: umm i need to know how much memory it takes to make a server because i need more than just 2-3 ppl tellin me how much memory i need a bunch of ppl so i can figure out the average so plz if u can tell me how much memory it takes to make ur own server. :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D

item.title: How much memory?
item.dc:creator: @hasumon hasumon
item.description:
@hasumon wrote:

Retarted posts ftw anyways these is what you need for an almost perfect server stability

1.) Comcast HS internet OR VPS OR Dedicated
2.) 2GB Ram if running on computer
3.) Windows XP if running on computer
4.) Dont sell staff positions
5.) Dont ask for donations
6.) If using wL, remove all the crappy glitchy voids you added or you will fail OR use Devolution
7.) If using wL, use a restarter to remove all the unused ram as it doesn’t drop the connection fully
8.) Run server for at least 15+ hours a day
9.) Actually add stuff in your server dont leech like 95% servers in mopar currently
10.) Learn about java
11.) Make a forum for a community
12.) Dont be a jackass spamming other servers since you got no one be patient

So far i got like 10 down >_>

Read full topic

item.title: How much memory?
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

Well if u have 4gb of RAM it shouldnt be too much of a problem but speaking from experience, after a while of running Vista 24/7 cracks start to appear and certain functions fail.

You could downgrade to XP which would free up atleast 512mb RAM and also uninstall any unnessecary programs which either use a fair amount of RAM or connect to the Internet.

Brendan

item.title: How much memory?
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

And how the fuck do you expect someone on here who struggles with compiling or portforwarding exactly how much memory their server takes.

What people have already said is it is effected by many different variables, some which you can effect and others which you cant control.

For example, if you have 4gb RAM but are then running Photoshop and COD4 you have lost around 1gb of RAM, Your OS will also effect it as XP isnt such a resource hog as what Vista is.

Also like others have told you, it will depend on the coding of your server, If using a wL base you aint going to get to the capacity you want as its too unstable and is poorly coded. If you can code properly use RS2DV which is much more stable but requires lots of coding.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: How much memory?
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Minimum: 512mb.
Do not get over 2gb, you’ll be wasting your money. Do not use wL unless you want the JVM to randomly crash without warning. Use a solid, correctly made server that does not use thread-per-client crap, etc.

If you have a low upload speed on your internet, do not bother hosting off your computer if you want a lot of people; instead get a VPS or dedicated with enough memory. If you want to hold 300 players then you’ll want 5mbps upload (or 3-4mbps upload)… The download speed won’t really matter.
As well, do not run it on vista, if you do you’ll need MORE memory (Winblows is a memory hog! not to mention a ton of wasteful services), install a *NIX distro (Arch Linux, Ubuntu, whatever you want) and run it using that.

Read full topic
